title: 130-150kbps connection to Riot servers?!?!
body: Why do I get 150k download from Riot's patch servers no matter where I am in town? It's obvious that countless others have the same issue... Do you guys not see this problem? Is it too hard to solve? Or are you actually trying to get less people to play your game?

replies.body:
Why do you think riot has any control over the speed of your internet?

That is just straight dumb. Your internet speeds are based on your service provider (primary cause), the route taken by your internet traffic (which has a lot to do with the service provider and location), and the slowest point along that route.

None of those things are things riot has any control over. If you had read any of their networking blog posts, you would know they are constantly working with ISPs and other networking companies to improve the routing of data to their servers so it takes more direct and fast paths.

Hi, hello, how are you? Hi.. ya, so it's not my connection bro.. I can download from other sites just fine... so do you still want to talk down to me and try to buttfuck riot? God you fanboys are a dime a dozen around here, go away with your useless bullshit.
I guess it could be my ISP, but you'd think their ISP would work with mine or something... get this shit figured out maybe? Or is that my job?

They do try to get the shit figured out, but it is very complicated and broken shit running on an infrastructure that is over a hundred years old and was never meant for videogames, streaming or gigabyte downloads.

Some of the technology behind the internet goes back to _telegraphs_.
After the NA server move from west coast to Chicago, everything was really messed up for a few months. It has steadily gotten a lot better. I believe there is a place to report issues like this, if it is an entire town or county experiencing the problem (all likely connected to the same ISP or physical network).
